__NOEDITSECTION__ __NOTOC__ '''''SMW+ 1.5.3 has been successfully installed!'''''
== About SMW+ == {| style="width: 97%" border="0" cellpadding="5" cellspacing="5" |- | valign="top" width="250" align="center" | [[Image:Mainpage.gif|link=]] | valign="top" width="auto" align="left" | SMW+ is a semantic enterprise wiki that is distributed by Ontoprise GmbH, Karlsruhe, Germany. This tool is well suited for organizations or teams dealing with heterogeneous and informal workflows and offers a rich feature set to create, share, publish and re-use knowledge contained in content. Ontoprise develops extensions to MediaWiki and carefully picks other useful extensions and, if having passed our quality assurance procedure, casts them into SMW+.
SMW+ includes Semantic MediaWiki (developed by Markus Kr√∂tzsch and Denny Vrandecic at the university of Karlsruhe) and the halo-Extension which is developed by Ontoprise in the HALO project, a Paul G. Allen initiative which is sponsored by his Seattle-based Vulcan Inc. (''[http://smwforum.ontoprise.com/smwforum/index.php/Faq/overview Read more...]'')
'''[[SMW+ 1.5|Overview of SMW+]]''' |} == Getting started == {| style="width: 90%" border="0" cellpadding="5" cellspacing="5" |- | valign="middle" width="250" align="center" | [[Image:Trafficlight.png|center|65px|link=]] | valign="top" width="auto" align="left" | To get you started with SMW+, we included a guide that features step-by-step instructions about creating and using annotations in your SMW+ installation. This guide shows you how to annotate a wiki article and how to query for these annotations. '''[[Getting started|See how to create your first annotation with SMW+]]''' |} == Getting help == {| style="width: 90%" border="0" cellpadding="5" cellspacing="5" |- | valign="top" width="250" align="center" | [[Image:Join.png|link=]] | valign="top" width="auto" align="left" | Find the complete user manual for SMW+ here: '''[http://smwforum.ontoprise.com SMW+ user forum]''' Visit the SMW+ User Community, which is hosted by Ontoprise, Vulcan Inc. and Monitor. Join in our regular user group meetings in north america and europe. *'''Share your experience:''' debate in the online forum and learn how others are using SMW+ *'''Learn to apply and customize:''' browse the comprehensive user manuals, read about the wealth of business applications and best practices and find out how to deploy, customize and integrate SMW+ *'''Contribute to the project:''' add and publish own materials and discuss with the engineering team or even contribute software '''[http://smwforum.ontoprise.com Enter the user forum here] '''
'''[http://smwforum.ontoprise.com/smwbugs/ Report Bugs here]''' ''(Read this before filing bugs: [http://smwforum.ontoprise.com/smwforum/index.php/Help:How_to_report_a_bug Help:How to report a bug])'' |} == Getting More Information == {| style="width: 90%" border="0" cellpadding="5" cellspacing="5" |- | valign="top" width="75%" align="left" | *You can get more information on SMW+ [http://smwforum.ontoprise.com here], including history and documentation *You can contact people from ontoprise via [http://www.ontoprise.de this page] *If you have any comments or questions, please feel free to contact us via smw@ontoprise.de or on SMW+ Discussion Board: [http://smwforum.ontoprise.com/smwboard/index.php http://smwforum.ontoprise.com/smwboard/index.php] *Don't forget to visit the website from colleagues at the University of Karlsruhe: [http://semantic-mediawiki.org http://semantic-mediawiki.org] |} ---- '''Now go semantic and have fun!'''

__NOTOC__
== About SMW+ == ==== What is SMW<sup>+</sup>? ====
SMW<sup>+</sup> is a semantic enterprise wiki that is distributed by Ontoprise GmbH, Karlsruhe, Germany. SMW<sup>+</sup> is well suited for organizations or teams dealing with heterogeneous and informal workflows. SMW<sup>+</sup> offers a rich feature set to create, share, publish and re-use knowledge contained in content. Ontoprise develops extensions to MediaWiki and carefully picks other useful extensions and, if having passed our quality assurance procedure, casts them into SMW<sup>+</sup>. [http://smwforum.ontoprise.com/smwforum/index.php/Faq/SMW%2B ''Read more...'']
==== Who is Ontoprise? ====
Ontoprise GmbH based in Karlsruhe, Germany, is a leading software provider of ontology-based solutions. Ontologies structure relevant know-how of your company, no matter how complex the relations are and how widely the information is scattered throughout the enterprise. [http://smwforum.ontoprise.com/smwforum/index.php/Faq/Ontoprise ''Read more...'']
==== What is "Project Halo"? ====
Vulcan Inc, based in Seattle, has established the long-term research program Project Halo to develop a ‚ÄúDigital Aristotle‚Äù that can serve as a comprehensive computer knowledge base and problem-solving system for natural sciences. Ontoprise GmbH has been elected as Vulcan's prime contractor to develop an extension (named "halo extension") to Semantic MediaWiki for Project Halo. The extended Semantic MediaWiki is serving as a web-based collaboration tool for the user-friendly and low-cost acquisition of scientific knowledge for Project Halo. [http://smwforum.ontoprise.com/smwforum/index.php/Faq/project_halo ''Read more...'']
==== Why are you claiming SMW<sup>+</sup> is a "semantic enterprise wiki"? ====
A wiki is a collection of web pages designed to enable anyone who accesses it to contribute or modify content quickly. Enterprises are adopting wikis more and more over the last years to make use of the wiki principle. Compared with other enterprise wikis SMW<sup>+</sup> ranks under the top three enterprise wikis. SMW<sup>+</sup> is a semantic enterprise wiki allowing casual users to include structured data into articles and, thus, organize articles in a graspable manner and to instantaneously exploit the data. Therefore SMW<sup>+</sup> is a full blown knowledge management system combining a wiki's social authoring approach with proven semantic technology. [http://smwforum.ontoprise.com/smwforum/index.php/Faq/Enterprise_semantic_wiki ''Read more...'']
==== How does SMW<sup>+</sup> compare to other enterprise wikis? ====
SMW<sup>+</sup> is providing a competitive level for requirements requested by professional users in the fields of reliability in daily operation, ease of procurement, commercial support contracts, minimal training efforts, access control and scalability. Thanks to its semantic technologies SMW<sup>+</sup> clearly outpaces non-semantic wikis in the fields of interoperability and expressivity. [http://smwforum.ontoprise.com/smwforum/index.php/Faq/Comparison_of_SMW%2B_with_other_enterprise_wikis ''Read more...'']
==== How does SMW<sup>+</sup> compare to other semantic wikis? ====
SMW<sup>+</sup> is a semantic wiki since it heavily employs semantic technologies (i.e. typed links, taxonomy and inferencing). SMW<sup>+</sup> outpaces other semantic wikis with respect to requirements requested by professional users (ease of procurement, commercial support contracts, interoperability). Thanks to its semantic technologies SMW<sup>+</sup> competes with other semantic wikis regarding expressivity level but it offers the best trade off between expressivity and computability. Also, SMW<sup>+</sup> users are efficiently supported with usability features to efficiently make use of the high level of expressivity. [http://smwforum.ontoprise.com/smwforum/index.php/Faq/Comparison_of_SMW%2B_with_other_semantic_wikis ''Read more...'']
==== Do you provide professional support? ====
When enterprises consider deploying a wiki then the availability of commercial support is imperative. Ontoprise accounts for the special needs of commercial implementations of SMW<sup>+</sup> (and Semantic MediaWiki) by offering technical support contracts, training for administrators and end-users and consulting, custom software development and system integration. [http://smwforum.ontoprise.com/smwforum/index.php/Faq/Professional_support_contracts ''Read more...'']
==== What does "GPL" mean? ====
SMW+ is open source software. It is licenced under the GPL General Public License. This license grants you the right to distribute SMW<sup>+</sup> in compliance with the conditions which are named in the GPL text. [http://smwforum.ontoprise.com/smwforum/index.php/Faq/GPL ''Read more...'']
==== What is the "Halo extension"? ====
Seattle-based Vulcan Inc has selected ontoprise GmbH as its prime contractor to develop an extension to Semantic MediaWiki for Project Halo; the extension is named Halo extension. The Halo extension improves Semantic MediaWiki in terms of interoperability and usability compared to competing semantic wikis. SMW<sup>+</sup>, ontoprise's business-ready distribution of Semantic MediaWiki including essential enhancements to it, comprises the Halo extension, too. [http://smwforum.ontoprise.com/smwforum/index.php/Faq/halo_extension ''Read more...'']
==== Where can I get more information? ====
You can browse the SMW<sup>+</sup> community web site to find user manuals and examples of applications: [http://smwforum.ontoprise.com http://smwforum.ontoprise.com].
Or simply drop us an email: [mailto:smw@ontoprise.de smw@ontoprise.de].
{{Part of bundle|value=Baseontologybundle}} [[Rationale::A simple promo article explaining what SMW+ and project halo are.| ]] {{Content hash|value=921b2a0671129b5106b33e9313370828}}

This page provides an overview and access to the most important features of SMW+. == Editing
== {| cellspacing="5" cellpadding="10" border="0" align="center" style="width: 200px; height: 122px;" |- | align="center" width="25%" valign="middle" | [[Image:SMWplus151_WYSIWYG.png|250px]] | align="center" width="25%" valign="middle" | [[Image:SMWplus151_annotationmode.png|250px]] | align="center" width="25%" valign="middle" | [[Image:SMWplus151_semantictoolbar.png|250px]] |- | align="left" valign="top" | === Easy Editing and Formatting === | align="left" valign="top" | === User-Friendly Annotation === | align="left" valign="top" | === Inspecting Semantic Annotations === |- | align="left" valign="top" | The WYSIWYG editor can be accessed via the '''tab ''Edit''''' at an article's page. With the WYSIWYG editor users can intuitively format text, create tables, embed images and other media into an article without having to cope with the wiki source text.
| align="left" valign="top" | The Advanced Annotation Mode provides a user-friendly method for annotating articles in the wiki. It can be accessed via the ''''annotate' link''' within the ''More'' tab and lets you annotate an article without the need to directly edit the plain wiki text. Instead, annotations can be made in-place by simply marking the text and assigning a value to it. | align="left" valign="top" | The Semantic Toolbar enables the easy creation of category annotations, property annotations and property attributes and frees the user from having to know the specific wiki text mark-up. It can be accessed via the '''Semantic Toolbar''' button in the WYSIWYG editor and is displayed alongside the text.
|} == Creating new articles == {| cellspacing="5" cellpadding="10" border="0" align="center" style="width: 200px; height: 122px;" |- | align="middle" width="25%" valign="middle" | [[Image:SMWplus151_createnewpage.png|250px]] | align="center" width="25%" valign="middle" | [[Image:SMWplus151_semanticforms.png|250px]] |- | align="left" valign="top" | === Creating new pages === | align="left" valign="top" | === Adding Data with Semantic Forms === |- | align="left" valign="top" | The dialog guides you through the creation process of a new page. You can choose if you like to create the page either with an editor or predefined forms. Access the '''[[Create_new_page|Create new page-Dialog]]'''
| align="left" valign="top" | Semantic Forms allow users to add and edit data using simple forms. It is suitable for recurring, structured data such as meeting minutes or data about persons and events. Choose one of the forms on the left hand side and start entering data.'''
''' |} == Querying == {| cellspacing="5" cellpadding="10" border="0" align="center" style="width: 200px; height: 122px;" |- | align="center" width="25%" valign="middle" | [[Image:SMWplus151_enhancedretrieval.png|250px]] | align="center" width="25%" valign="middle" | [[Image:SMWplus151_queryinterface.png|250px]] | align="center" width="25%" valign="middle" | [[Image:SMWplus151_tsc.png|250px]] |- | align="left" valign="top" | === Powerful Searching === | align="left" valign="top" | === Dynamic Querying === | align="left" valign="top" | === Storing and Retrieving RDF Data === | align="left" valign="top" |
|- | align="left" valign="top" | The search capability of SMW+ is powered by the Enhanced Retrieval component. It is based on the state-of-the-art search engine Lucene (which is also used in the Wikipedia search) and enables users to better find relevant contents scattered across a wiki. Just type a term in Search field in the header or go to '''[[Special:Search|Specialpage Search]]''' | align="left" valign="top" | The Query interface helps you to exploit the full power of Semantic MediaWiki's query mechanism. It provides a graphical user interface that supports you in building such queries in an intuitive manner. Access this tool via the '''[[Special:QueryInterface|Specialpage QueryInterface]]'''
| align="left" valign="top" | Triple stores are special databases that allow to store and retrieve RDF data efficiently. With a triple store enabled SMW+ you can query the knowledge base directly within the wiki or from remote by using SPARQL queries. The latter method is useful if other applications shall exploit the semantically annotated data residing in your wiki. The '''[[Special:TSA|special page TSA]]''' helps you to administrate the wiki/triplestore connection.
''(Learn more about attaching a triple store to SMW+ here: [http://smwforum.ontoprise.com/smwforum/index.php/Help:TripleStoreConnector_Basic Help:Working with Triple store])'' |} == Curating == {| cellspacing="5" cellpadding="10" border="0" align="center" style="width: 200px; height: 122px;" |- | align="center" width="25%" valign="middle" | [[Image:SMWplus151_ontologybrowser.png|250px]] | align="center" width="25%" valign="middle" | [[Image:SMWplus151_gardening.png|250px]] | align="center" width="25%" valign="middle" | [[Image:SMWplus151_haloacl.png|250px]] |- | align="left" valign="top" | === Navigating through Ontology === | align="left" valign="top" | === Maintaining Quality === | align="left" valign="top" | === Managing User Rights === | align="left" valign="top" |
|- | align="left" valign="top" | The Ontology Browser gives a fast and precise overview of the wiki's ontology (i.e. its semantic knowledge model). It allows users to navigate through the category and property hierarchy and to inspect instances and their characteristics. It can be accessed via the '''[[Special:OntologyBrowser|Specialpage OntologyBrowser]]'''
| align="left" valign="top" | The Gardening tool suite of SMW+ is a set of programs that allow you to improve the quality of your wiki. With the help of the Gardening Framework you can check the knowledge base for inconsistencies and detect anomalies such as undefined entities, pages without annotations or empty categories. It can be accessed via the '''[[Special:Gardening|Specialpage Gardening]]'''
| align="left" valign="top" | With the Access Control Lists component you can restrict the access to different elements of your wiki for single users or entire user groups. It enables the protection of namespaces (e.g. the namespace of 'special' pages), categories (e.g. for articles belonging to the category 'protected') and single article pages (e.g. for the article 'internal administration'). It can be accessed via the '''[[Special:HaloACL|Specialpage Halo ACL]]'''
| align="left" valign="top" |
|} == Connectivity and Importing Features == {| cellspacing="5" cellpadding="10" border="0" align="center" style="width: 200px; height: 122px;" |- | align="middle" width="25%" valign="middle" | [[Image:Excel install1.jpg|250px]] | align="center" width="25%" valign="middle" | [[Image:SMWplus151_dataimport.png|250px]] | align="center" width="25%" valign="middle" | [[Image:Project install1.jpg|250px]] |- | align="left" valign="top" | === Exporting Data to Excel === | align="left" valign="top" | === Importing External Data === | align="left" valign="top" | === Synchronizing Data with MS Project === |- | align="left" valign="top" | The MS Excel Bridge allows you to query an SMW+ knowledge base and import the results into Excel spreadsheets. This way you can e. g. easily transfer project data gathered in your wiki and reuse it for further calculations in Excel. The client is shipped as a separate Windows installer for easy deployment.
'''[http://shop.ontoprise.com/ Download MS Excel Bridge]'''
'''[http://smwforum.ontoprise.com/smwforum/index.php?title=Help:Administration_of_MS_Excel_Bridge How to install MS Excel Bridge]'''
'''[http://smwforum.ontoprise.com/smwforum/index.php/Help:MS_Excel_Bridge Documentation]'''
| align="left" valign="top" | This feature allows you to call external web services from the wiki and integrate the web service results directly into your wiki articles. This way you can e.g. hook in the Bugzilla web service, in order to include bug entries from Bugzilla in those wiki pages that describe your affected software components. You can see '''[http://smwforum.ontoprise.com/smwforum/index.php/Example:Library_of_webservices examples of the web services here]'''. | align="left" valign="top" | With the MS Project Connector you can easily export your project data from the Wiki into your MS Project client. This is especially usefull when you use the Wiki to collaboratively set up the project and you move then into the project performance phase to monitor the progress. The client is shipped as a separate Windows installer for easy deployment.
'''[http://shop.ontoprise.com/ Download MS Project Connector]'''
'''[http://smwforum.ontoprise.com/smwforum/index.php?title=Help:Installing_MS_Project_Connector How to install MS Project Connector]'''
'''[http://smwforum.ontoprise.com/smwforum/index.php/Help:MS_Project_Connector Documentation]''' |}

== Introduction == This tutorial is the optimum entry-level for first time SMW+ users. You will learn in this tutorial: *how to make freehand annotations with the Advanced annotation mode in an article *how to retrieve the new annotations with the Query interface *how to process all those data in an article == Prerequisites == *You are [http://smwforum.ontoprise.com/smwforum/index.php/Help:Logging_in logged in] *You know [http://smwforum.ontoprise.com/smwforum/index.php/Help:Creating_a_new_page how to create new pages] == Create a new page == Imagine you wish to write quickly a new task for your colleague Fred. The task is part of the "Test project" and Fred should update the screenshots in the internal documentation.
  1. Create a new page with the title "Update screenshots"
  2. Copy and paste the following text snippet into the page:
    Update screenshots
Description
During the next phase, it is necessary to update the screenshots in the internal documentation.
Assignee
Fred
Start time
25.07.2010
Deadline
30.07.2010
Related to
This task is part of the Test project.
  3. Format the text as shown in the example below:
    [[Image:TUT_firstannotation1.png|thumb|left|400px|Formatting example in the WYSIWYG editor]]
  4. Save the page
'''Result: Your newly created page looks like this:'''
[[Image:TUT_firstannotation.png|left|thumb|400px|New task with a few facts, but not yet semantic.]] == Add freehand annotations == Now let's start to add your first annotations. === Annotate a category ===
  1. Click '''More > Annotate''' to switch to the Advanced annotation mode
    [[Image:TUT_firstannotation2.png|left|thumb|250px|The Advanced annotation mode let's you add freehand annotations]]
    2. '''The Semantic toolbar appears at the bottom right of the page'''
  2. Click '''Annotate'''
    [[Image:TUT_firstannotation3.png|left|thumb|250px|Annotate a category in the Semantic toolbar]]
  3. Type Task into the '''Category''' field
    [[Image:TUT_firstannotation4.png|left|thumb|250px|The green highlighting indicates that this category exists]]
  4. Click '''Add'''
    5. '''Result: Now you have annotated the article to the category "Task".'''
=== Annotate properties === Let's make the property annotations.
  1. Select the description from the text with the mouse
    The box "Specify this property" pops up:
    [[Image:TUT_firstannotation5.png|left|thumb|550px]]
  2. Enter Description in the field '''Property''' {{NoteInText|Pressing the keys {{Keys|Ctrl}} + {{Keys|Alt}} + {{Keys|Space}} opens the autocompletion function}}
  3. Click '''Add'''
    4. The highlighted text indicates the annotation. Click [[Image:B_AAMdelete.png]] to delete the annotation; click [[Image:B_AAMedit.png]] to edit the annotation. Now you can process with the other annotations.
  4. Select "Fred" with the mouse, enter Assigned to and click '''Add'''
  5. Annotate the start time with the property Start date
  6. Annotate the deadline with the property End date
  7. Annotate "Test project" with the property Related to project
    8. Now your article looks like this:
    [[Image:TUT_firstannotation7.png|left|thumb|550px|Annotated text is highlighted in the Advanced annotation mode]]
  8. Finally click '''Save annotations'''
    [[Image:TUT_firstannotation8.png|left|thumb|250px|All annotations saved]]
  9. Check your done annotations
    [[Image:TUT_firstannotation9.png|left|thumb|250px|The property section summarizes all made annotations]]
  10. Click on the '''Page''' tab to leave the Advanced annotation mode
=== Results of these steps === Now you have made your first freehand annotations with SMW+. *You have created an article and assigned the category "Task". *You have annotated the various information parts within this article. *To sum up: You have made the facts of this article "semantic". == Query for the new annotations == === Create the first query === So let's see what you can do with the semantic data.
  1. Open the special page [[Special:QueryInterface|QueryInterface]]
  2. Click '''Add category''' {{NoteInText|Like in the Semantic toolbar you can press the keys {{Keys|Ctrl}} + {{Keys|Alt}} + {{Keys|Space}} to use the autocompletion}}
  3. Enter Task
    [[Image:TUT_firstannotation10.png|left|thumb|550px|Query for all articles in the category "Task"]]
  4. Click '''Add'''
    5. Below the section '''Result preview''' you see all pages (instances) that are assigned to the category "Task". When you scroll the list, you notice the new task "Update screenshots":
    [[Image:TUT_firstannotation11.png|left|thumb|400px|Here is your article]]
  5. Click '''Add property'''
  6. Enter Assigned to
  7. Activate the checkbox '''Show in results''' to list the property values in the result preview
  8. Activate the checkbox '''Value must be set''' to get only results that have explicitly this property
  9. Activate the radiobutton '''Specific value'''
  10. Enter Fred in the field '''Property value'''
    11. [[Image:TUT_firstannotation12.png|left|thumb|550px|Summary of the query definition]]
  11. Click '''Add'''
    12. '''In the Result preview you see now all tasks Fred is assignee of (in this case only one).'''
    [[Image:TUT_firstannotation13.png|left|thumb|250px|Result preview]]
=== Create an advanced query === Now, we want to try an advanced query to demonstrate, what more you can do with the Query interface. Let's assume Fred has started to work on the task "Updating screenshots" and he has added the status on the corresponding task page. To be more exact, he has added the property "Percent complete" with the value "75%".
  1. Click on the property "Assigned to" in the right section:
    [[Image:TUT_firstannotation14.png|left|thumb|250px|You can change the properties to query]]
  2. Click '''Delete''' to remove this property from the query
    [[Image:TUT_firstannotation15.png|left|thumb|550px|Edit view of a property in the Query interface]]
  3. Instead, add the property '''Percent complete''' to the query
    [[Image:TUT_firstannotation16.png|left|thumb|400px|The Result Preview show all tasks with their status in percent]]
  4. Click '''Format Query''' to adjust the query results
  5. Select in the dropdownlist '''Format''' '''ofc-bar (ofc-bar)'''
    [[Image:TUT_firstannotation17.png|left|thumb|550px|The Result Preview changes from the table format to the ofc-bar format]]
  6. Close the section '''Query definition''' to get a larger preview of the results
    7. '''The Query interface supports several [http://smwforum.ontoprise.com/smwforum/index.php/Help:Semantic_Result_Formats semantic result formats]''', like line, pie, timeline, list...
=== Embed the query into an article === In the last step you have formulated a query about the tasks and their status. Now it's time to embed this query in an article, so that you can watch the further process of the tasks.
  1. Click '''Query source''' to get the sourcecode of the query
    [[Image:TUT_firstannotation18.png|left|thumb|250px|Queries in the wiki are formulated in the ASK syntax]]
  2. Select the sourcecode and copy it to clipboard by pressing the keys {{Keys|Ctrl}} + {{Keys|C}}
  3. Create a new page
  4. Switch to wikitext mode [[Image:B_wikitext.gif]]
  5. Press the keys {{Keys|Ctrl}} + {{Keys|V}} to paste the query sourcecode into the text.
  6. Save the page
    7. '''Now you have placed a nicely formatted query in an article, which indicates all tasks and their status visualized with Semantic result formats.''' [[Image:TUT_firstannotation19.png|left|thumb|550px|Visualized query in an article]] {{NoteInText|To update the page, means get the latest changed facts, click '''Refresh'''}} === Results of these steps === *You have got to know the Query interface *You have created a query to retrieve your freehand annotations *You have created an advanced query with spe *You have visualized the query with the help of Semantic result formats *You have embedded the query results into another article == Related topics == Instead of opening the specialpage Query interface, you can directly open the Query interface while editing an article in the WYSIWYG editor's toolbar by clicking [[Image:B queryinterface.gif]] *[http://smwforum.ontoprise.com/smwforum/index.php/Help:Description_of_the_WYSIWYG-Editor Description of the WYSIWYG editor] *[http://smwforum.ontoprise.com/smwforum/index.php/Help:Formatting_text Formatting text] *[http://smwforum.ontoprise.com/smwforum/index.php/Help:Adding_queries Adding queries] [[Rationale::This article is a step-by-step guide for new users about how to enter the first annotation into this wiki and how to query for it.| ]] {{Part of bundle|value=Baseontologybundle}} {{Content hash|value=8ccdac6750116b265a14f1aed38e821b}}
